title: NATYASHALA CHARITY TRUST
detailsOfAchievement: Natyashala Charity Trust (Natyashala), is a pioneering cultural and educational institution implementing various schemes and projects for children with disabilities and their teachers all over India since 1981. Natyashala has been a mentor to the disabled and their teachers in the field of music, dance, puppetry and educational drama. It has trained about 7500 children, 7000 teachers and has so far staged over 1200 shows of 72 plays in all over India. Natyashalaâ€™s use of performing arts as a therapy, as a means of rehabilitation and itâ€™s dedicated services have been applauded and appreciated by stalwarts in the field of education and culture. The result oriented projects implemented in urban, suburban and rural areas during last 34 years:- 1) Play Productions : Over 1200 performances of 72 plays in Marathi, Hindi & English (childrenâ€™s & adultâ€™s plays, street plays, mime skits). All these play productions are of high standards with rich production on value based themes. 2) Bharatiya Vadya Zankar : Music ensembles 3) Creative Dramatics Workshops : 4) Teacher-Training Programmes in theatre arts : 5) State level music, dance, drama competitions involving about 100 special schools, 2000 child artists, 500 teachers and 13,000 audience members every year. 6) Festivals : Participation in state and national cultural festivals giving disabled artists a platform along with other national level artists and providing expertise guidance and technical assistance for organisation. 7) Rang Tarang : Two weekâ€™s multidimensional presentation oriented training camp-cum-cultural meet of the disabled involving over 150 children in each programme. 8) Natyashala has its unique theatre repertoire consisting of hearing and visually impaired artists along with other regular artists. These artists perform plays on social and educational themes at theatres, schools, rural areas and in theatre festivals. The repertoire artists also visit schools to impart training in creative dramatics and demonstrations of educational plays. Natyashalaâ€™s repertory artistsâ€™ theatre movement has created a strong base for expanding its network in rural areas. 9) Publication : 1) Gosht Tumchi Aamchi - Marathi play based on Std III History Syllabus 2) Life on Earth - English play based on Std III History Syllabus 3) Maharashtra Amucha - Marathi play based on Std III and IVth Geography Syllabi Compilation of 13 volumes of 188 one act plays (Hindi, Marathi, Konkani & Gujarati) contributed by school teachers trained in Natyashalaâ€™s training programmes and competitions, based on school text and moral values. Natyashalaâ€™s child-centric multifarious social, cultural and educational activities have brought miraculous changes in the participating children and teachers and have empowered them in social, educational and economic fields Natyashala Charity Trustâ€™s mission of therapeutic and educational use of Performing Arts has amazingly contributed to integration and rehabilitation of children with special needs. Natyashala has given them confidence to face the challenges of today and share the hopes of tomorrow. The commendable work of Natyashala Charity Trust has been highly acclaimed and supported by many renowned state and national level cultural and social organizations.

detailsOfAchievement: Nityaasha Foundation at present have 2 programs for underprivileged children between 0â€“18 years of age. PROGRAM MADHURAASHA: Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus The Foundation started its 1st program â€œMadhuraashaâ€ on 1st Augustâ€™2013, which focuses on children with Type 1 Diabetes and has registered 163 children till now under its care. PROGRAM DIVYAASHA: Epilepsy in Children The Foundation embarked into its 2nd program â€œDivyaashaâ€œon 28th Februaryâ€™15, focusing on Children with Epilepsy and has registered 26 children under its care till now. With a Vision to provide an equal opportunity for all to cherish the gift of life and a Mission to bestow healthy life by fulfilling the medical needs of the under privileged through holistic support the Foundation works for the overall development of its children. If well looked and managed properly a child with such disorder can lead a normal, qualitative, productive life. In these 3.5 years of journey, the foundation has 1.Provided support by taking care of the medical Aid (Insulin, Glucometer, Strips, syringes, lancets),Anti-Epileptic medicines, Annual Checkups (Eyes & Dental) and Quarterly HbA1c & Annual pathology tests/EEG,MRI for the needy children. 2. For storage of insulin dispensed 40 mitticool refrigerators to the families. 3. Conducted free cataract surgery (T1DM children tend to develop cataract as a result of diabetes complication). 4. Regular monitoring through free Doctor Consultation, diet / Social Counselling, periodic Home/School Visits, Follow-up Phone calls. 5. Extra attention is given to children with high HbA1c with additional counseling and monitoring. 6. Organized Cooking demonstrations of Diabetes recipes for mothers & children. Prepared Diabetes recipe booklets. 7. Prepared the families to accept this lifelong disorder & educated them to have better understanding and manage medical emergencies. 8. Focusing on the overall development, made the children understand the importance of academic education, arranged educational funds for some children. 9. Conducted Aptitude Tests and Career Counseling of 37 children till date. 10. Organized motivational, Counseling, Mentoring & fun events for children and their families. 11.With our support & constant interventions there was an incredible decrease in hospitalization and increase in school attendance. 12.Built confidence and developed positive attitude to lead a normal life and also established strong faith, rapport and bonding with the families. 13.Working towards a livelihood project focusing on providing vocational training and skill up gradation program for adolescent girl children and mothers of registered children. The silver line is with a handholding support the children can empower themselves to overcome the limitation. Nityaasha with its dedicated team has been relentlessly working to better the life of the minors affected by these crippling disorders with a good success rate. However the challenge is bigger and more support is required.
